item.title: Punjab: Slain gangster Vicky Gounder’s father found dead on rail track in Muktsar
item.description: Mehal Singh Bhullar, 66, had been missing from his house at Sarawan Bodla village in Muktsar since Monday

item.title: Notified area in Morni block: HC restrains Haryana from construction work
item.description: Order came on the plea of a local who had submitted that Punjab Land Preservation Act was enacted to save Shivalik area from land erosion and most of the land of Morni Hills area is notified under Sections 3, 4 and 5 of the Act
item.itunes:title: Notified area in Morni block: HC restrains Haryana from construction work

content:encoded.p: Order came on the plea of a local who had submitted that Punjab Land Preservation Act was enacted to save Shivalik area from land erosion and most of the land of Morni Hills area is notified under Sections 3, 4 and 5 of the Act

item.description: Armed protesters seeking release of Sikh prisoners attack police personnel, smash vehicles on being stopped from entering Chandigarh to meet Punjab CM

item.title: Speed up four-laning of Himachal highways, Sukhu urges Gadkari
item.description: Himachal Pradesh chief minister Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu on Wednesday urged Union minister for road transport and highways Nitin Gadkari to speed up the expansion of national highways in the state, especially on Kiratpur-Manali, Parwanoo-Shimla, Chakki-Mataur-Shimla and Nalagarh-Swarghat stretches

item.title: Himachal braces for another spell of snow, yellow alert issued
item.description: Himachal is set for another spell of snow and rains as a fresh western disturbance became active over the north-western Himalayas on Wednesday; a yellow alert warning for thunderstorms and lightning over plains, low hills and mid hills has also been issued for February 9 and 10
item.itunes:title: Himachal braces for another spell of snow, yellow alert issued

content:encoded.p: Himachal is set for another spell of snow and rains as a fresh western disturbance became active over the north-western Himalayas on Wednesday; a yellow alert warning for thunderstorms and lightning over plains, low hills and mid hills has also been issued for February 9 and 10

item.title: Farmers-police scuffle in Ambala over land acquisition for road project
item.description: Official sources said that a large area of land, spread across 28 kilometres, in Nagla, Kodwa Khurd and Babak Majra villages has to be possessed in the sub-division for the four laning project of Ambala-Kala Amb road.
item.itunes:title: Farmers-police scuffle in Ambala over land acquisition for road project

content:encoded.p: Official sources said that a large area of land, spread across 28 kilometres, in Nagla, Kodwa Khurd and Babak Majra villages has to be possessed in the sub-division for the four laning project of Ambala-Kala Amb road.

item.title: Contractual workers protest shifting of Haryana’s lone DD Kendra to Chandigarh
item.description: As many as 30 permanent staff had been shifted to Chandigarh and other stations on January 15 after the Union government decided to shut down operations at DD Hisar, which had been functioning for the last 21 years. Station director Pawan Kumar said the order from the Centre did not mention the reason behind the shifting of the Hisar kendra.
item.itunes:title: Contractual workers protest shifting of Haryana’s lone DD Kendra to Chandigarh

content:encoded.p: As many as 30 permanent staff had been shifted to Chandigarh and other stations on January 15 after the Union government decided to shut down operations at DD Hisar, which had been functioning for the last 21 years. Station director Pawan Kumar said the order from the Centre did not mention the reason behind the shifting of the Hisar kendra.

item.title: High court refuses stay on e-tendering for panchayats in Kurukshetra
item.description: The HC bench of justice Vikas Bahl sought response from the government by April 11, in a plea filed by 14 odd panchayats in which they had argued that the instructions are ultra vires (beyond the powers) and contrary to the basic structure of Panchayati Raj Institutions (PRIs).
item.itunes:title: High court refuses stay on e-tendering for panchayats in Kurukshetra

content:encoded.p: The HC bench of justice Vikas Bahl sought response from the government by April 11, in a plea filed by 14 odd panchayats in which they had argued that the instructions are ultra vires (beyond the powers) and contrary to the basic structure of Panchayati Raj Institutions (PRIs).

item.title: 10 years on, Karnal’s agro mall turned into export house
item.description: Union home minister Amit Shah will inaugurate the export house on February 14; built on 2.02 lakh sq-ft, the Karnal agro mall has 86 shops on the ground floor and 46 offices on the top floor.
item.itunes:title: 10 years on, Karnal’s agro mall turned into export house

content:encoded.p: Union home minister Amit Shah will inaugurate the export house on February 14; built on 2.02 lakh sq-ft, the Karnal agro mall has 86 shops on the ground floor and 46 offices on the top floor.

item.title: Haryana power utility officials booked for fraud in Ambala
item.description: The accused include Uttar Haryana Bijli Vitran Nigam (UHBVN) sub-divisional officer (SDO) Harish Goyal, chartered accountant (CA) Dimple, lower division clerk (LDC) Anoop Jain and Ravinder Sehgal, member, CM window grievances redressal and monitoring system.

item.title: Schools of Eminence: 117 schools shortlisted , Govt fast-tracks upgrade of 4 Amritsar schools
item.description: Days after it shortlisted 117 existing schools for the flagship ‘Schools of Eminence’ Scheme, the Aam Aadmi Party government in Punjab has set the ball rolling for upgrading four of these schools in Amritsar district on priority.

item.title: No fresh damages, GSI team to submit report soon: Doda DC on land subsidence
item.description: Doda deputy commissioner Vishesh Pal Mahajan said, “The GSI’s report hasn’t been submitted to the administration yet. The team, in fact, wanted more information from us on rainfall and other aspects, which has been furnished to its members by the meteorological department. We are expecting the report by tonight or tomorrow.”
item.itunes:title: No fresh damages, GSI team to submit report soon: Doda DC on land subsidence

content:encoded.p: Doda deputy commissioner Vishesh Pal Mahajan said, “The GSI’s report hasn’t been submitted to the administration yet. The team, in fact, wanted more information from us on rainfall and other aspects, which has been furnished to its members by the meteorological department. We are expecting the report by tonight or tomorrow.”

item.title: Terrorists behind Rajouri attack hiding in the area: J&K Police advisory
item.description: In an audio advisory issued late on Tuesday, the police also warned of strict action against those helping the terrorists in any way, while reiterating that a reward of ₹10 lakh will be given to those providing information about them

item.title: CBI arrests Chandigarh Police ASI while accepting ₹25,000 bribe
item.description: The ASI was posted at the Manimajra police station. Complainant was an accused in an abetment to suicide case registered against him on December 24. He has alleged that the Chandigarh Police ASI had demanded ₹50,000 from him to clear his name from the case.The cop was arrested red-handed by the CBI.
item.itunes:title: CBI arrests Chandigarh Police ASI while accepting ₹25,000 bribe

content:encoded.p: The ASI was posted at the Manimajra police station. Complainant was an accused in an abetment to suicide case registered against him on December 24. He has alleged that the Chandigarh Police ASI had demanded ₹50,000 from him to clear his name from the case.The cop was arrested red-handed by the CBI.

item.title: Punjab Cricket Association to hold elections for vacant posts on February 25
item.description: Punjab Cricket Association has been without a president for nearly four months, since the resignation of Gulzar Inder Singh Chahal on October 2022. Vice-president Gagan Khanna and treasurer Rakesh Walia had also followed him out. The PCB will hold elections for vacant posts on February 25
item.itunes:title: Punjab Cricket Association to hold elections for vacant posts on February 25

content:encoded.p: Punjab Cricket Association has been without a president for nearly four months, since the resignation of Gulzar Inder Singh Chahal on October 2022. Vice-president Gagan Khanna and treasurer Rakesh Walia had also followed him out. The PCB will hold elections for vacant posts on February 25

item.title: Col CK Nayudu Trophy: Chandigarh-Maharashtra tie ends in draw
item.description: Maharashtra declared their innings at 252/3 and set a target of 259 in the Col CK Nayudu U-25 Trophy match. In reply, the hosts could manage 202/6. Chandigarh’s last league match is scheduled against Goa on February 12 at the same venue.
item.itunes:title: Col CK Nayudu Trophy: Chandigarh-Maharashtra tie ends in draw

item.title: Mohali police cut 3 snatchers’ crime spree short
item.description: The accused snatchers were identified as Kamalpreet Singh of Kharar and Kulwir Singh of Fatehgarh Sahib. Their accomplice, Vikram Singh of Fatehgarh Sahib, managed to flee. Police said the duo had been involved in snatchings in Balongi and Kharar. Probe into string of snatching cases in Mohali led to the arrests.
item.itunes:title: Mohali police cut 3 snatchers’ crime spree short

content:encoded.p: The accused snatchers were identified as Kamalpreet Singh of Kharar and Kulwir Singh of Fatehgarh Sahib. Their accomplice, Vikram Singh of Fatehgarh Sahib, managed to flee. Police said the duo had been involved in snatchings in Balongi and Kharar. Probe into string of snatching cases in Mohali led to the arrests.

item.title: Khelo India Youth Games: Chandigarh judokas bring home 3 golds, one bronze
item.description: In the girls’ 40kg event of Khelo India Youth Games, Sapna took gold, while Angel Yadav won gold in girls’ 44kg. In the boys’ 55kg event, Himanshu claimed gold, while Divyansh Kataria bagged bronze in boys’ 50 kg event. With this effort, Chandigarh has moved up to the 15th position
item.itunes:title: Khelo India Youth Games: Chandigarh judokas bring home 3 golds, one bronze

content:encoded.p: In the girls’ 40kg event of Khelo India Youth Games, Sapna took gold, while Angel Yadav won gold in girls’ 44kg. In the boys’ 55kg event, Himanshu claimed gold, while Divyansh Kataria bagged bronze in boys’ 50 kg event. With this effort, Chandigarh has moved up to the 15th position

item.title: Punjab-origin man in Australia pleads guilty to killing ex-girlfriend
item.description: A 22-year-old Punjab-origin man has pleaded guilty to killing his former girlfriend in 2021 and dumping her body in a shallow grave in South Australia’s Flinders Ranges, according to media reports.
item.itunes:title: Punjab-origin man in Australia pleads guilty to killing ex-girlfriend

content:encoded.p: A 22-year-old Punjab-origin man has pleaded guilty to killing his former girlfriend in 2021 and dumping her body in a shallow grave in South Australia’s Flinders Ranges, according to media reports.

item.description: Shiromani Akali Dal leader Harsimrat Kaur Badal on Wednesday said that Bharatiya Janata Party led Union government had failed farmers, the poor and also has been discriminating against the Sikh community.

item.description: The order specified that for amalgamation, units’ structural stability certificate shall be submitted by allottees and prior permission of Chandigarh Housing Board secretary must be obtained. item.description: UT health secretary Yashpal Garg said, “In the recently allotted Union Budget, UT administration will now take up the agenda to set up effluent treatment plants in three civil hospitals and GMCH’s south campus in Sector 48.”

item.title: CBSA, CGC Landran hold panel discussion on Union Budget
item.description: Attended by over 200-plus students and faculty members, objective of the session was to discuss and analyse key aspects of the Union Budget and its overall impact on the country’s economic and social growth. It was organised by the department of MBA, CBSA, CGC Landran in association with CII, Chandigarh

item.title: ‘Custodial violence’: Ambala Police register FIR against jail officials
item.description: In his plea, a jail inmate had levelled allegations against the jail authorities and co-inmates having been subjected to custodial violence. Three days later, he was summoned to appear in the court where his “oath statement” was recorded and he stated that marks of injury were still present on his body
item.itunes:title: ‘Custodial violence’: Ambala Police register FIR against jail officials

item.title: Noted philosopher Himmat Sinha passes away
item.description: Widely known as ‘Nazim’ of Kurukshetra, Sinha had taught Philosophy of Bhartiya Sanskriti at the Kurukshetra University for nearly 30 years. The Haryana Urdu Akademi award winner has written over 200 articles in various newspapers and 22 books in English, Hindi and Urdu.
item.itunes:title: Noted philosopher Himmat Sinha passes away

content:encoded.p: Widely known as ‘Nazim’ of Kurukshetra, Sinha had taught Philosophy of Bhartiya Sanskriti at the Kurukshetra University for nearly 30 years. The Haryana Urdu Akademi award winner has written over 200 articles in various newspapers and 22 books in English, Hindi and Urdu.

item.description: The woman’s son Around 6:30 pm my mother had gone to a neighbourhood shop to purchase vegetables. Minutes later, our maid informed us that she was lying near a wall soaked in blood. With the help of neighbours, she was taken home, where a doctor was called who declared her dead,

item.title: Snatchers in car take away woman’s purse in Chandigarh
item.description: Snatchers struck again in Chandigarh, this time riding a car. The victim, Madhu, 27, a resident of Jhampur, Mohali. Two men were inside the car, and the one on her side got off and snatched her purse, before fleeing in the car with his accomplice.
item.itunes:title: Snatchers in car take away woman’s purse in Chandigarh

item.description: The Mohali CIA busted an interstate gang of auto lifters and arrested six persons and recovered 35 stolen vehicles, besides ₹4.8 lakh in cash from their possession. The gang stole a total of 52 vehicles, mostly cars, from Mohali in the past eight months.

content:encoded.p: Haryana chief minister (CM) Manohar Lal Khattar on Tuesday chaired a pre-budget consultation meeting, in which cabinet ministers and top rank officers were present.

item.title: EAC report puts Haryana low on personal safety index: Bhupinder Hooda
item.description: Quoting an independent research, Social Progress Index report, by Institute for Competitiveness (IFC), former Haryana chief minister Bhupinder Singh Hooda said that the state was among some of the poor performing states in terms of personal safety index with a score of 33.04.
item.itunes:title: EAC report puts Haryana low on personal safety index: Bhupinder Hooda

content:encoded.p: Quoting an independent research, Social Progress Index report, by Institute for Competitiveness (IFC), former Haryana chief minister Bhupinder Singh Hooda said that the state was among some of the poor performing states in terms of personal safety index with a score of 33.04.

item.title: Haryana BJP state executive meeting from February 10 to 11
item.description: To prepare for 2024 Lok Sabha and state assembly elections; Haryana BJP president Om Prakash Dhankar and chief minister Manohar Lal Khattar will be the key speakers during the two-day meeting which will be held at Maharana Pratap College, Bhiwani.
item.itunes:title: Haryana BJP state executive meeting from February 10 to 11

content:encoded.p: To prepare for 2024 Lok Sabha and state assembly elections; Haryana BJP president Om Prakash Dhankar and chief minister Manohar Lal Khattar will be the key speakers during the two-day meeting which will be held at Maharana Pratap College, Bhiwani.

item.title: Chandigarh: PU deans’ election on February 20; profs above 60 to participate
item.description: According to a senior PU official, professors serving above the age of 60 will be included in the voters list this time. As per the schedule issued on Tuesday, the deans of 11 faculties and secretaries will be elected on February 20 by senators, added members, professors and heads of departments.
item.itunes:title: Chandigarh: PU deans’ election on February 20; profs above 60 to participate

content:encoded.p: According to a senior PU official, professors serving above the age of 60 will be included in the voters list this time. As per the schedule issued on Tuesday, the deans of 11 faculties and secretaries will be elected on February 20 by senators, added members, professors and heads of departments.

item.title: Caddy golf tournament: Sonu, Vikram walk away with top spot
item.description: 50 caddies from all over the tricity and Jammu and Kashmir participated in First North India Caddy Golf Tournament . The tournament was played as a best ball format. Sonu and Vikram got ₹12,000 as prize money. Sahul and Sonu finished second taking ₹7,000 home while Mahinder and Sundar were third.
item.itunes:title: Caddy golf tournament: Sonu, Vikram walk away with top spot

content:encoded.p: 50 caddies from all over the tricity and Jammu and Kashmir participated in First North India Caddy Golf Tournament . The tournament was played as a best ball format. Sonu and Vikram got ₹12,000 as prize money. Sahul and Sonu finished second taking ₹7,000 home while Mahinder and Sundar were third.

item.title: Unique visual art exhibition by differently-abled artists impresses tricity
item.description: Italian artist Giorgio de Chirico once said, “To become truly immortal, a work of art must escape all human limits: logic and commonsense will only interfere
item.itunes:title: Unique visual art exhibition by differently-abled artists impresses tricity

content:encoded.p: Italian artist Giorgio de Chirico once said, “To become truly immortal, a work of art must escape all human limits: logic and commonsense will only interfere

item.title: Government College of Education celebrates International Year of Millets
item.description: The event was organised in collaboration with MGNCRE & Nivedita Foundation, propagating the use of millets. College principal Dr Sapna Nanda welcomed the chief guest, Virender Garg, OSD to Union health minister, Government of India, and special guests Shyampriyaa from Lokayurveda Foundation, Dr Lipika Guliani, assistant professor, UIHTM, PU, Chandigarh, and Kalyani, member of NIVEDITA Foundation.
item.itunes:title: Government College of Education celebrates International Year of Millets

content:encoded.p: The event was organised in collaboration with MGNCRE & Nivedita Foundation, propagating the use of millets. College principal Dr Sapna Nanda welcomed the chief guest, Virender Garg, OSD to Union health minister, Government of India, and special guests Shyampriyaa from Lokayurveda Foundation, Dr Lipika Guliani, assistant professor, UIHTM, PU, Chandigarh, and Kalyani, member of NIVEDITA Foundation.

item.title: Chandigarh: Copper wires stolen from Sector 28 shop
item.description: In his complaint, Shesh Kumar of Dhanas told the police that he works as a senior manager at Domino’s Pizza in Sector 28, Chandigarh. He said on January 26, the freezer of the company was not working. On checking, they found that 12 meters of the copper wire of the AC was stolen.
item.itunes:title: Chandigarh: Copper wires stolen from Sector 28 shop

content:encoded.p: In his complaint, Shesh Kumar of Dhanas told the police that he works as a senior manager at Domino’s Pizza in Sector 28, Chandigarh. He said on January 26, the freezer of the company was not working. On checking, they found that 12 meters of the copper wire of the AC was stolen.

item.title: Spice of Life : Dusky is not dusty, treat black as white
item.description: It’s time we shun the idea ruling our cognitive minds at subliminal levels that the outer complexion of a person is more valuable, and rather divert our attention into judging the inner and real beauty of someone’s heart that is devoid of any colour bias, writes UN Upadhaya
item.itunes:title: Spice of Life : Dusky is not dusty, treat black as white

content:encoded.p: It’s time we shun the idea ruling our cognitive minds at subliminal levels that the outer complexion of a person is more valuable, and rather divert our attention into judging the inner and real beauty of someone’s heart that is devoid of any colour bias, writes UN Upadhaya

item.title: SC to hear Punjab govt plea against bail to Majithia in drugs case after 4 weeks
item.description: Bhagwant Mann-led government has challenged high court’s August 10 order, which stated there were “reasonable grounds” to believe the Akali leader was not guilty
item.itunes:title: SC to hear Punjab govt plea against bail to Majithia in drugs case after 4 weeks

content:encoded.p: Bhagwant Mann-led government has challenged high court’s August 10 order, which stated there were “reasonable grounds” to believe the Akali leader was not guilty

item.title: Punjab: Former minister Dharamsot sent in three-day VB remand in assets case
item.description: Mohali court sends the former forest minister and Congress leader in vigilance bureau custody for questioning in corruption case
item.itunes:title: Punjab: Former minister Dharamsot sent in three-day VB remand in assets case

item.title: Ladakh’s mega solar power project delayed, to be ready by 2026
item.description: Union finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced in budget that inter-state transmission system for evacuation and grid integration of 13GW renewable energy from Ladakh to Kaithal in Haryana will be built with investment of ₹20,700 crore, including central support of ₹8,300 crore
item.itunes:title: Ladakh’s mega solar power project delayed, to be ready by 2026

content:encoded.p: Union finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced in budget that inter-state transmission system for evacuation and grid integration of 13GW renewable energy from Ladakh to Kaithal in Haryana will be built with investment of ₹20,700 crore, including central support of ₹8,300 crore

item.title: Punjab: Firing outside Ludhiana court, all three accused flee
item.description: Police detain two persons following the clash; both parties had come to attend a hearing in the court in a case of house trespass
item.itunes:title: Punjab: Firing outside Ludhiana court, all three accused flee

content:encoded.p: Police detain two persons following the clash; both parties had come to attend a hearing in the court in a case of house trespass

item.title: Army rescues 35-yr-old elephant in Uttarakhand; condition remains critical
item.description: A team of 38 Indian army personnel from Bengal Engineer Group and Centre (BEG & Centre), Roorkee, are building a makeshift structure to help the elephant stand up in order to treat the animal
item.itunes:title: Army rescues 35-yr-old elephant in Uttarakhand; condition remains critical

content:encoded.p: A team of 38 Indian army personnel from Bengal Engineer Group and Centre (BEG & Centre), Roorkee, are building a makeshift structure to help the elephant stand up in order to treat the animal
